trans-unit.target:
<comment>Install Command:</comment> <info>zyos:install</info> <comment>=============================</comment>
This process will generate the execution of several commands in the order entered with the environment in which this process should be executed, it simplifies the different processes to be executed.
Examples of use:
<info>php bin/console zyos:install</info> <comment>[<environment>]</comment> <info>php bin/console zyos:install</info> <comment>dev</comment> <info>php bin/console zyos:install</info> <comment>prod</comment>
In certain cases when it is required to run Doctrine Fixtures, it is necessary to enter the environment option.
<info>php bin/console zyos:install</info> <comment>dev</comment> <info>--env=dev</info> <info>php bin/console zyos:install</info> <comment>prod</comment> <info>--env=dev</info>
<error>Keep in mind:</error> when the command is executed in production, a lock is created which does not allow this command to be executed again.

<comment>Symlink Creation Command:</comment> <info>zyos:create:symlink</info> <comment>======================================================</comment>
The process of creating symlinks generates in a simplified way the deployment of the application in work teams is the fastest way to deploy the symlink.
Examples of use:
<info>php bin/console zyos:create:symlink</info> <comment>[<environment>]</comment> <info>php bin/console zyos:create:symlink</info> <comment>dev</comment> <info>php bin/console zyos:create:symlink</info> <comment>prod</comment>
In certain cases it is required to run in a specific environment, it is necessary to enter the environment option.
<info>php bin/console zyos:create:symlink</info> <comment>dev</comment> <info>--env=dev</info> <info>php bin/console zyos:create:symlink</info> <comment>prod</comment> <info>--env=dev</info>

<comment>Create Mirror Command (Directory Copy):</comment> <info>zyos:create:mirror</info> <comment>==========================================================</comment>
The process of creating a copy of directories (Mirror) implicitly generates the deployment of the application on work computers. It is the fastest way to deploy the configured directories.
Examples of use:
<info>php bin/console zyos:create:mirror</info> <comment>[<environment>]</comment> <info>php bin/console zyos:create:mirror</info> <comment>dev</comment> <info>php bin/console zyos:create:mirror</info> <comment>prod</comment>
In certain cases it is required to run in a specific environment, it is necessary to enter the environment option.
<info>php bin/console zyos:create:mirror</info> <comment>dev</comment> <info>--env=dev</info> <info>php bin/console zyos:create:mirror</info> <comment>prod</comment> <info>--env=dev</info>

<comment>Execute Command CLI (Command Line Interface):</comment> <info>zyos:execute:cli</info> <comment>==============================================================</comment>
Execution process of operating system commands for development processes and is executed through PHP.
Examples of use:
<info>php bin/console zyos:execute:cli</info> <comment>[<environment>]</comment> <info>php bin/console zyos:execute:cli</info> <comment>dev</comment> <info>php bin/console zyos:execute:cli</info> <comment>prod</comment>
In certain cases it is required to run in a specific environment, it is necessary to enter the environment option.
<info>php bin/console zyos:execute:cli</info> <comment>dev</comment> <info>--env=dev</info> <info>php bin/console zyos:execute:cli</info> <comment>prod</comment> <info>--env=dev</info>
<error>Keep in mind:</error> unexpected behaviors can occur due to permissions or execution limitations.

<comment>Execution Command Validations:</comment> <info>zyos:execute:validation</info> <comment>======================================================</comment>
Validation process of the different configured items which must be validated before being deployed or to see their viability in production.
Examples of use:
<info>php bin/console zyos:execute:validation</info> <comment>[<environment>]</comment> <info>php bin/console zyos:execute:validation</info> <comment>dev</comment> <info>php bin/console zyos:execute:validation</info> <comment>prod</comment>
In this process it could show validations like:
<comment>*</comment> File or directory exists <comment>*</comment> is file <comment>*</comment> Is directory <comment>*</comment> Is symlink <comment>*</comment> Is executable <comment>*</comment> Is readable <comment>*</comment> Is writable

<comment>Import SQL Files Command:</comment> <info>zyos:sql:import</info> <comment>=========================================</comment>
This command executes the different configurations to import sql files through Doctrine you just have to pass the corresponding environment to run in the configured order.
Examples of use:
<info>php bin/console zyos:sql:import</info> <comment>[<environment>]</comment> <info>php bin/console zyos:sql:import</info> <comment>dev</comment> <info>php bin/console zyos:sql:import</info> <comment>prod</comment>

<comment>Export Database Command (Dump):</comment> <info>zyos:sql:export</info> <comment>======================================================</comment>
This command will generate the process of exporting the selected database to an SQL file this process can select several options which will help this process.
<error>NOTICE</error> this process is initially supported only and solely by MySQL through the <info>mysqldump</info> command.
Examples of use:
<info>php bin/console zyos:sql:export</info> <comment>[<configuration>]</comment> <info>php bin/console zyos:sql:export</info> <comment>[<configuration>]</comment> <info>--option</info> ... <info>php bin/console zyos:sql:export</info> <comment>configuration_name</comment>
Export all data (Structures, data, etc) <info>php bin/console zyos:sql:export</info> <comment>configuration_name</comment>
Create extended INSERT INTO <info>php bin/console zyos:sql:export</info> <comment>configuration_name</comment> <info>--extended-insert</info>
Don't create tables <info>php bin/console zyos:sql:export</info> <comment>configuration_name</comment> <info>--no-create-tables</info>
Export only INSERT INTO <info>php bin/console zyos:sql:export</info> <comment>configuration_name</comment> <info>--no-create-database --no-create-drop-tables --no-create-lock-tables -no-create-tables</info>
Assign file name <info>php bin/console zyos:sql:export</info> <comment>configuration_name</comment> <info>--result-file=</info>"<comment>file.sql</comment>"
